wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Henry Knighton-Hammond (18 September 1875 – 28 February 1970) was born in Arnold, Nottinghamshire as Arthur Henry Hammond. Knighton-Hammond was an English painter best known for landscapes, society portraits and industrial paintings. Knighton-Hammond used a variety of styles but is most famous as a water-colourist.

response: *Arthur Henry Knighton-Hammond (1875–1970), watercolour painter, born in Arnold.
* Arthur Henry Knighton-Hammond (1875–1970) – English painter best known for landscapes, society portraits, and industrial paintings
The Crook o' Lune was also the subject of watercolours by S. J. "Lamorna" Birch and Reginald Aspinwall, and of paintings in oils by Arthur Henry Knighton-Hammond and William Hoggatt.
